data.title: Manager, Planning, Engineering & Safety
data.meta_description: We are seeking an experienced and innovative Manager of Planning, Engineering & Safety to lead a dynamic team and oversee various traffic management and safety initiatives within Strathcona County. This […]
data.text:
Strathcona County

Website

Sherwood Park, AB

Closes August 11, 2024

Manager, Planning, Engineering & Safety

We are seeking an experienced and innovative Manager of Planning, Engineering & Safety to lead a dynamic team and oversee various traffic management and safety initiatives within Strathcona County.

This position will manage and guide traffic signal engineering, the traffic management center, traffic data collection, and traffic operations. Additionally, this role will focus on managing safety-related programs, including the implementation and evaluation of high-profile projects.

This role influences service delivery, program development, policy, bylaw, and priority direction. A key responsibility of the manager will be planning and executing programs aimed at preserving public safety through the application of engineering principles, while also promoting effective communication, education, and evaluation.

This role may be eligible to participate in our hybrid work program. The successful candidate will be required to reside within 2 hours of Sherwood Park, Alberta.

Responsibilities:

Provide Council, the public, and internal/external stakeholders with sound advice and engineering rationale for traffic engineering and safety concerns while maintaining policies, bylaws, and strategic plans to support these initiatives

Ensure the appropriate master plans and policies are in place to support an efficient, effective and economic multi-model transportation system

Coordinate the annual budget process specific to the department’s transportation capital works for annual and long-range purposes

Prepare department project business cases for presentation to the executive team and Council

Review, recommend, and approve traffic safety, operations, and management initiatives to improve the transportation network

Manage the operation and maintenance of the traffic signal network and program including all new intersection signal installations, operations, maintenance, and upgrades

Complete research-based pilot projects and traffic safety audits, reporting the findings to the community through public engagements

Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with community agencies and organizations to coordinate a collaborative approach to service delivery

Act as the department contact for external parties such as Alberta Transportation and surrounding municipalities on transportation matters, which includes media interviews and public speaking

Qualifications and Skills:

Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering plus at least 10 years of transportation engineering experience

Must be registered as a Professional Engineer with APEGA

At least 5 years of experience in a supervisory or leadership role, demonstrating strong managerial skills and the ability to lead cross-functional teams effectively

Management experience in a political and public environment is desired

A Master’s degree in Transportation Engineering is considered an asset

Professional Traffic Operations Engineer (PTOE) and Road Safety Professional (RSA) Certifications would be an asset

Sound knowledge of transportation planning, transportation modeling, traffic safety engineering, road design, and public engagement is essential

Possess financial skills as related to project cost estimates and capital budgeting

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are required to effectively communicate highly technical concepts to broad, diverse audiences through written and oral means

A high level of political acumen and confidentiality is required

Conditions of Employment:

Valid Alberta Class 5 Driver’s license and submission of a 5-year Driver’s Abstract with less than 7 demerits

Who We Are:

Strathcona County is a specialized municipality located in the heart of Alberta. Our vision is to become Canada’s most livable community, where our workplace culture and identity are supported by our people plan and values of integrity, respect, safety, fairness, and cooperation.

Why Join Strathcona County: (depending on position)

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, which includes:

Extended health and dental coverage

Health and wellness spending account

Life and disability insurance and critical illness programs

Retirement and pension programs

Paid and unpaid leave programs

Earned day off program

Employee and family assistance program

Commitment to employee development, through internal and external training and development opportunities

Well-being programs and a safety culture focused on physical and psychological health in the workplace

Equivalencies of education and experience may be considered.

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies for similar positions within the next 6 months.

Strathcona County is committed to an inclusive, respectful, and equitable workplace that represents the community we serve. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds who can contribute diverse perspectives and experiences.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
